content:
Hi, 
I'm on a big deal to know the current acceleration of my missiles when they have been just fired. We have to know acceleration because when a missile is given the WAIT command, its last acceleration is preserved.
So, to guess the acceleration on new missiles, I have to memorize the acceleration given by my ship command " | M ax ay", and next turn I have to detect in the input data which unit corresponds to the new missile. And there, there is a little problem : 
I cannot compare the idents because I don't know how many new units will appear from the opponent
I could compare coordinates but to do so, I have to simulate the missile move on the five ticks
I could find which missile from new input was not present in the last input, and it is probably the simplest method.
Another solution would be to get this information in the input... 
Due to the data conservation from a round to another, coding the simulator is a bit tricky.
I could consider too that guessing all that is a part of the challenge :D

Hi, 
I haven't found yet the victory conditions in the referee. Maybe you could add them in the game summary.
This game is very interesting

Hey there i have faced an issue -
I got this error -
The game has crashed. Please contact the author and enclose the following error:

java.util.NoSuchElementException
	at java.base/java.util.Scanner.throwFor(Scanner.java:937)
	at java.base/java.util.Scanner.next(Scanner.java:1478)
	at com.codingame.game.Player.getAction(Player.java:87)
	at com.codingame.game.Referee.gameTurn(Referee.java:193)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.GameManager.start(GameManager.java:122)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.RefereeMain.start(RefereeMain.java:67)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.RefereeMain.main(RefereeMain.java:50)

when i print this - `print("| F", x, y)`
though the command is wrong but the game crashes causing a draw you need to fix this.
Else great game great work!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I've enjoyed playing this game. It's a lot of fun. This is a good contribution.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's fun!
Wow, you really worked hard on this one.
It's a very nice contribution !

This is very nice - well done. However, I have some suggestions:
Perhaps it is too complicated (too many inputs and possible outputs) for newcomers and beginners. Also, you have to fire relative to your ship instead of at a given point - not so easy for beginners. So maybe make the game easier in the beginner leagues.
State in the description the origin of the map.
Finally, the image (2 horses on a hill) doesn't seem to have any connection to the game.
i recommend a planet in the middle, and resources to collect for partial reward / fuel / more bullets
Hello it's a very nice contribution ! But the output are very hard to learn, I don't understand what I owe to print....

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Pretty nice and original.
Eventually have some shooting game on this website.
Thank you!

Hi,
I'm not sure if I fully understand your question -
the output should consist of orders for your units - namely for your ship and missiles (if there are any on the board) - exactly one line per unit.
Lines should be written in this form: 
unit_id | action_type [dir_x dir_y] | action_type [dir_x dir_y] | ...

So say you want to put acceleration (3, 2) on your ship, which has id 1, and at the same time fire a bullet in direction (-4, 7). Then the line for your ship should be
1 | A 3 2 | F -4 7

If you want your ship to just wait in this turn, you print
1 | W

The same goes for any of your missiles. So say you own a ship (id 23) and two missiles (ids 9 and 11). You want the ship to wait and both missiles to detonate. Then you print 3 lines:
23 | W
9 | D
11 | D

Does it answer your question?

Hi,
this was actually our initial thought - to make some obstactles on the board to make movement harder, but eventually the game turn out to be hard enough as it is. In fact you can see in the other comments that some people consider it too hard for the beginners.
We decided to focus on basic simulation and aiming, which alone is quite challenging, rather than implementing even more game logic.

Hi, I am a co-author of the game. We added the information about the origin of the map to the description.

> you have to fire relative to your ship instead of at a given point - not so easy for beginners. So maybe make the game easier in the beginner leagues.

The premise of the game was to remain fairly physically accurate, and as such bullets inherit the velocity of the ship when fired. 

That means firing at a given position (that is, firing in such a way that hitting the given point is guaranteed) would require taking the ship's velocity into account. This would make it somewhat annoying to use for someone who wants to do the targeting manually (which I think is required at any non-trivial level), as they would effectively need to reverse the computation to fire in the direction they want. In that situation I feel like firing in a selected direction is more natural.

Do you have an idea how the beginner leagues could be simplified? The guidelines suggest interface should not change between leagues, and I also wouldn't want to change existing game mechanics between leagues - I recall I was quite annoyed in other games when it turned out what I wrote to leave lower leagues made little sense in the full game.

>  the image (2 horses on a hill) doesn't seem to have any connection to the game.

Yes, for some reason contributions are shown with the author's profile picture, and we don't know if it is possible to change it (looking at the list of contributions no one else was able to do that).
Thank you!
Thank you!

Thanks!
The error should be fixed now, I hope it was the last one :)

Hi R4N4R4M4,

glad you liked the game!
When I look at it now I think you're right, victory conditions should be better exposed and explained in more detail. We'll most probably try to change it soon.

Yeah, this is a bit cumbersome, but unfortunately any change in how the input / output works now is not really possible, since it would break the bots already playing in the arena.

We used the method with finding the missile that was not present in the last input in our test bots.

I think that complexity is in the nature of the game, except the distinction between turns and ticks, which may not be very clear in the description (do positions increase by 1/5 of velocity each tick?). And as I understood "rounds" are the same as "turns", then only one word should be used for it, for better clarity, given that we also got "ticks".

About the inertia on the bullets (adding velocity from the ship), it takes just a subtraction to correct it, which I think is kinda simple compared to estimating where a moving enemy ship might be in X turns.

As a suggestion for simplifying the beginner's league, I think the ships might start just a little closer together so that one can get started just by firing at the other's direction with max bullet speed, without the need to move and still dealing some (not full) damage. So, with simpler commands and math, one still gets some results.

Hi Lehanius,

you were right about the turns and rounds, the naming could have been misleading. We've corrected it now, so only "turns" are mentioned in the statement. We've also tried to clarify the meaning of "ticks" along with what it means that the ship is going at speed <number>. 

We've also changed the starting position in the first league so that it's possible to shoot down the opponent without moving the ship.

Nice, I think it is clearer and easier to start with. 

Haven't used missiles yet but it already seems like a very fun game to compete in.

thank I under :)
stand !
If there is anything that should be added to the statement to make it clearer, just let me know :)
I think add one or two exemple of output would be a good thing
Sure, I'll add something as soon as I have a while!
Super !
So it's added, I hope it's clear now :D

Nice shooting game. I mislead myself while printing missile commands, I produced invalid output, but the referee did not notice it to me.

Standard output:
S | A 6.0 0.0 | F 100.0 0.0 | M 30.0 0.0
2 | A 30.0 0.0 | 6 | A 30.0 0.0

Hi philRG,
I tried to reproduce your (lack of) error, but I did not manage to do it. For me the referee always says '6' is an invalid action. Do you remember what units did you have in the situation you mentioned?
Or maybe do you have the code you used then, and remember against whom (Boss? which one?) the match was? (You can ping me privately if this is the case)
We really want our game to behave correctly!
anyway the rules are well explained and I did fix my output commands rapidly, so this is a minor bug I suppose for a community contest

There should be an information about why the player was eliminated written on the game progress bar (the one below the game window, indicating which round is now showing). We didn't think about putting it where the player outputs are, though it's probably a good idea... The weekend is approaching, so I'll definitely look at it!

Ah yes, there was a green bullet on the progress bar I did not see indicates that 3 lines were expected and player was eliminated for this reason. Weapons are not quite easy to master (lots of rules to implement), and thus not easy to implement a beginner's strategy in league 2 and 3 (very few bots to fight against them). Also, I am not quite familiar with simulation algorithms (though I master physics & maths)
Okay, now game summary also appears where the player outputs are. Actually it's even more readable now, as the information is sometimes too long to fit in the progress bar :)

Ok thanks! It is much more convenient to read now... :-)

Game summary :
philRG eliminated! Reason: Timeout! (3 lines expected)
